name: Fundamentals
heading: The main points:
body: One minute of a movie should translate to roughly one page in a screenplay.

name: Setting the Scene
heading: Establishing shots:
body: Let your audience know where the scene takes place, first by establishing the city, with a landscape shot. From there, establish the street, building, or room we will meet our characters in.

name: Natural Dialogue
heading: Let it flow:
body: Just because someone said something in real life doesn't necessarily mean it'll make for good screenplay dialogue.

name: Plot Structure
heading: Every story has three things:
body: 1. A beginning 2. A middle 3. An end

name: Characterization
heading: Well rounded characters:
body: What is your character's motivation? How might you be able to show that through action and dialogue?
